alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 7:29PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN QUAY AND NORTHEASTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM MDT... At 729 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Wheatland, or 30 miles southeast of Tucumcari, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Jon, Grady, Glenrio, Broadview, Wheatland, Bellview and Bard. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 352 and 373. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for east central New Mexico.
